questionTitle: I took that faulty kettle back to the shop where I'd bought it and asked the ________ if they would change it for me.
Flora: You're awfully behind with the work, aren't you? aisy: I know. I ________ to the cinema last night.
You will spend at least one year working abroad ________ you can find out how things operate overseas.
I can ________ with most things but I cannot stand noisy children.
I think he is ________ his time looking for a job there; they are not taking any staff on at present.
It is a good idea to be ________ dressed when you go for a interview.
I was pleased to see how ________ she looked after her recent illness.
Shall we ________ across this field instead of going by the road?
Write to me and tell me ________ about your holiday in Switzerland.
It's rude to interrupt when someone else is ________.
Betty: I didn't really enjoy the party last night. Adela: No, and ________.
________ of the month, I hope I shall have lost another two kilos.
I reasoned ________ him, but he would not listen to me.
He is responding ________ treatment and will soon be cured of his illness.
Nothing will prevent him ________ succeeding.
He criticised everything and everybody and even ran ________ his few friends.
Why did you have ________ his last lecture?
I was sitting in a cafe ________ afternoon when I saw the Prime Minister pass by.
The ________ question in this case is whether the accused had a motive for this crime or not.
She's the best assistant I've ever had. I couldn't ________ for a better one.
